column1: Supplemental Table 4. Macronutrient composition of bear foods calculated from the USDA National Nutrient Database. Quercus spp. (acorns) and Pinus spp. (pinenuts) were collected in Yosemite National Park in 2007. Stoichiometric measurements were recorded for each food (A) and dry weight was calculated (B). Digestible [C] and [N] was calculated using the equations above Table C.

column4: Units = gm X/100 gm wet weight

column2: Units = gm X/100 gm dry weight

column1: Factors for calculating macronutrient dry weight from Robbins (1993) unless specified
Digest [N] = Protein N * 0.466 (digestibility of pinenuts; used for acorns) from Mealey (1980)

Mealey, S. P. 1980. The natural food habits of grizzly bears in Yellowstone National Park, 1973-1974. Page 281–292 in C. J. Markinka and K. L. McArthur, editors. Bears—their biology and management: proceedings, fourth international conference on bear research and management. Bear Biology Association, Kalispell, Montana, USA.
Robbins C. T. 1993. Wildlife feeding and nutrition, 2nd edition. Academic Press, San Diego, California, USA.
